snippet: The rules would eliminate some loopholes that allow brokers to avoid acting as fiduciaries when providing advice on retirement accounts like 401(k)’s.
abstract: Labor Dept proposes rules that would bind far larger group of investment professionals to fiduciary duty, forcing them to put their investors' interest first; rules, more than four years in the making, are intended to provide greater consumer protection for roughly $7 trillion in retirement assets that are held in accounts like 401(k)s and individual retirement accounts.
lead_paragraph: The rules would eliminate some loopholes that allow brokers to avoid acting as fiduciaries when providing advice on retirement accounts like 401(k)’s.

headline.main: U.S. Plans Stiffer Rules Protecting Retiree Cash
headline.print_headline: U.S. Plans Stiffer Rules Protecting Nest Eggs
